Menus.Description: TC Facilities Management (TCFM) is now playing a part in helping an unnamed on-line retailer achieve speedy grocery deliveries from their DC in London.
Menus.DetailDescription:
TC Facilities Management (TCFM) is now playing a part in helping an unnamed on-line retailer achieve speedy grocery deliveries from their DC in London.

The contract being delivered by a team from TCFM started on 8th December 2016. It will provide cleaning services to a Distribution Centre responsible for its groceries delivery in London. 

The team from TCFM, led by Charlotte Mudge, TCFM Account Manager, will ensure that the superb standards that TCFM have become known for in other DCs will be replicated and with it enable the retailer to deliver consistently speedy shopping solutions.

The contract will utilise rigorous systems and state-of-the-art technology to help to deliver robust monitoring and management reporting to the client.

Having been able to demonstrate the added value within other cleaning contracts in DCs, the contract was awarded based on TCFM’s proven track record in the warehouse space along with their design of a bespoke solution, based on the client’s individual needs.

Steve Wengrow, Divisional Director, TCFM commented, “We are delighted to have been awarded this contract and are looking forward to bringing our proven experience to enable this client to maintain and build upon their good onsite Health & Safety Record by keeping floor space clean and clear of potential risks as they meet their customers’ needs for speedy grocery deliveries.”
Menus.Title: TC Facilities Management (TCFM) secure cleaning contract with on-line retailer

Menus.Description: Klenzan Ltd, based in Warrington, Cheshire, launches its new eco-friendly pre-dosed range of concentrated surface cleaning products, under the brand name Green’ R.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Klenzan Ltd, based in Warrington, Cheshire, launches its new eco-friendly pre-dosed range of concentrated surface cleaning products, under the brand name Green’ R.

The Green’ R range of cleaners and sanitisers are eco-friendly products that come in pre-dosed water-soluble sachets that dissolve in under 60 seconds and a disinfectant tested and approved for effective bacterial reduction.

One small pack of 20 x 5g sachets equates to 15 litres of chemical solution, when dissolved saving on storage constraints and reducing chemical handling activities. The Green’ R range comprises 18 types of cleaner, in small and large packs, ten x 10g sachets per pack and 150 x 14 g sachets, respectively.

Klenzan Managing Director, John Bell, commented, “Green’ R provides a cost effective, compact and consistent answer to high quality hygiene in catering and food establishments large and small. Many outlets struggle for space and need an easy, safe to use solution for keeping things clean. Green’ R offers a range of products to tackle every day to day cleaning task.”

An independent company with over 26 years’ experience, Klenzan is one of the UK’s most trusted providers of industrial hygiene solutions. Its proactive commitment to research and development has put Klenzan at the forefront of innovative, effective hygiene management and control.
Menus.Title: Klenzan launches Green’ R pre-dosed cleaning sachets

Menus.Description: Calbarrie Compliance Services Limited, the UK’s market leader in electrical compliance services, has been awarded a place on a new three-year Electrical Testing Services framework (306) with Eastern Shires Purchasing Organisation (ESPO) to deliver electrical testing services to ESPO customers across the UK.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Calbarrie Compliance Services Limited, the UK’s market leader in electrical compliance services, has been awarded a place on a new three-year Electrical Testing Services framework (306) with Eastern Shires Purchasing Organisation (ESPO) to deliver electrical testing services to ESPO customers across the UK. 

Calbarrie has provided Portable Appliance Testing to ESPO customers since 2013. Within the new framework, which runs until 2019, Calbarrie has the opportunity to supply Portable Appliance and Fixed Installation Testing to ESPO’s customers who are in the public sector. 

Calbarrie has specialised in the provision of electrical testing services for over 35 years and employs more than 100 engineers nationally. The company demonstrated that it met ESPO’s key requirements, and scored high on all aspects of the award criteria to secure a place on the framework.

Tim Beardsmore, Calbarrie’s Commercial Director said, “We are proud to be part of the new ESPO framework and are looking forward to building on our successful relationship with ESPO and its customers. Companies who are part of the framework have the reassurance that they are receiving a market-leading service and price proposition and they do not have to go out to tender each time their testing is due.”
Menus.Title: Calbarrie secures place on new ESPO framework

Menus.Description: Independent environmental consultancy NBC Environment warns firms working in the building and facilities management sectors should focus attention on wildlife mitigation now to avoid potential delays to projects in 2017.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Independent environmental consultancy NBC Environment warns firms working in the building and facilities management sectors should focus attention on wildlife mitigation now to avoid potential delays to projects in 2017.

Under UK law (Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981) it is illegal to move or destroy any bird's nest and in some cases disturbing nesting birds is even prohibited. Non-compliance with this legislation can lead to significant financial penalties or prosecution that may extend to a prison sentence.

John Dickson, Managing Director of NBC Environment, says, “Companies have a responsibility to assess the impact their operations may have on ecology in the local environment. Ignorance is no defence in the eyes of the law, therefore you must be satisfied there are no nesting birds present on site before any works commence.

“They can be easily overlooked, different species nest in trees or shrubs, on the ground or in buildings. As such, failure to effectively survey a potential development in advance of operations is unwise.”

With the nesting season fast approaching, typically March to July, NBC advises businesses should use the time remaining to work with ecologists to proof sites and disperse wildlife to designated conservation zones.
Menus.Title: Why birds in bushes can lead to costly handouts... or worse

Menus.Description: Millboard, known for its high-end decking, has launched a suite of cutting- edge cladding materials that will further enhance the company’s reputation as one of Britain’s leading home and garden material manufacturers
Menus.DetailDescription:
Millboard, known for its high-end decking, has launched a suite of cutting-
edge cladding materials that will further enhance the company’s reputation
as one of Britain’s leading home and garden material manufacturers.

In its thirteen year history, Millboard has continually broken new ground
with its decking, which today is a feature of many prestigious venues
around the world including the Burj Al Arab, Kew Gardens and Wimbledon, as
well as being found in numerous private homes.

The new range of cladding takes its cue from the same first-rate attributes
of the decking range. It provides the identical assurance of UV resistance
and eliminates the risk of warping, twisting or rotting. And just like the
decking range, the cladding has been hand-moulded from carefully selected
natural timbers, to provide an unmistakably organic look.

The new cladding is available in two styles, ‘Millboard Envello Shadow Line
Cladding’ and ‘Millboard Envello Board and Batten Cladding’, each coming in
a wide range of colours, ensuring that there is a Millboard cladding style
for every property type. More than a year in development, the cladding is
perfectly designed to stand the test of time with the minimum of
maintenance. In fact, the distinctive chamfered cut of the profiles means
that when it rains it actually serves to clean the boards, reducing even
further the need for upkeep or maintenance.

The cladding is made from a polyurethane-mineral composite that boasts
greater eco credentials than rainforest-depleting timber. The unique
properties of this enduring material mean that its owners will never suffer
from streak marks around window seals, be disappointed by dramatic colour
changes, or have to maintain it with expensive and time-consuming
treatments.

The extra-wide sizing of the boards means that the cladding can be mounted
quickly, enabling a lightning-fast transformation of the exterior of a
property. The boards can also be used internally, to create feature walls
and dividers.

In addition, the cladding can be mounted vertically or horizontally to suit
the tastes of the architect or homeowner. When mounted vertically, a clever
modification of the tongue and groove joints even enables fuss-free
installation around curved surfaces. The tongue of the board also features
a notch which the fixings are aligned with, so that each board covers over
the fixing to create an entirely clean finish.

At the launch of the product, Marketing Manager, Caroline Birdall,
commented, “All of us here at Millboard are very excited about this new
range and are confident of its success, based as it is on our decking
product which already enjoys a well-established and loyal following among
architects and designers. The development of the new cladding range
represents a significant milestone for the company, marking our expansion
into a broader range of high-calibre home and garden products.”

Millboard Cladding was officially launched in November 2020.

For more information about the product range, or to request free samples,
visit Millboard’s website at: www.millboard.co.uk or contact the team on
02476 439943 or email: enquiries@millboard.co.uk
Menus.Title: Changing the face of façades: Millboard launches ground-breaking Envello cladding collection

Menus.DetailDescription:
Storage building specialists Autobuild Ltd have recently enhanced their range of flat pack buildings with a range of storage buildings designed for schools, which include condensation proofing.

The buildings are arranged to fit the customer's site dimensions and are designed using a sophisticated computer package enabling prices to be calculated in a few minutes. 

“Once we know the length, width, colour and height of the building and details of ancillary items, like roller doors, personal access doors or skylights, prices can be given to the customer over the telephone or on email. We can adjust dimensions if necessary to suit their budget,” said Laurence Osborne, Autobuild's Managing Director.

Buildings are delivered flat and bolted together on site to form the finished product. To enable the schools to obtain the best advice before ordering, Autobuild can arrange a site visit and produce a set of plans and a structural design certificate. The buildings all conform to British Standards.

Menus.Description: Supplied through UK distributor Loxston Groundcare, national equipment hire company A-Plant have added a further eight Irus remote controlled mowers to their groundcare equipment fleet.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Supplied through UK distributor Loxston Groundcare, national equipment hire company A-Plant have added a further eight Irus remote controlled mowers to their groundcare equipment fleet.

For A-Plant, Groundcare Business Development Manager David Kendall said, “We have had Irus as a part of our specialist slope-mowing offering for some time and have had no issues with them.

“The build quality is exceptional and the unique tilting engine gives the operative a balanced machine with proven capabilities when cutting at up to 50 degree angles for extended periods. Our latest order was for five Quadrak wheeled mowers and three Deltrak tracked machines.”

Peter Loxston said, “Irus are ‘go-anywhere’ machines capable of mowing in places where people can’t. Operated by way of multi-channel radio and designed for mowing and maintenance of vegetation on precipitous slopes, parks, roadside verges and railway embankments, they offer reduced risk of injury to operators.”

IRUS offer a range of implements to fit their machines, including forestry pulveriser, stump grinders and rotary and scythe mowers.
Menus.Title: A-Plant add more Irus remote mowers to the fleet

Menus.Description: Wrightstyle, the advanced steel and aluminium glazing system company, recently completed three elevations of structurally-glazed curtain walling measuring over 50 metres in length as part of recent work on the eastern ticket hall of Crossrail’s Farringdon station.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Wrightstyle, the advanced steel and aluminium glazing system company, recently completed three elevations of structurally-glazed curtain walling measuring over 50 metres in length as part of recent work on the eastern ticket hall of Crossrail’s Farringdon station.

As part of Crossrail’s Art Programme, British artist Simon Periton designed an artwork for the curtain walling featuring an intricate pattern that reflects the elaborate Victorian metalwork of the historic Smithfield Market directly opposite.

During the day, the artwork will allow passengers to see inside to the coffered ceiling that echoes the Brutalist architecture of the nearby Barbican, whilst changing shadows will be cast across the interior space.

In the evening, the station lights will illuminate the design from inside, offering a dramatic new perspective to those on the nearby streets.

Wrightstyle is currently working on seven out of the 40 stations on the Elizabeth line, including Bond Street, Paddington, Farringdon, Liverpool Street, Whitechapel and Woolwich. The new Farringdon station is expected to serve 82,000 passengers every working day.

Specialist glass from Hero Glass was chosen for the project “which pushed the capabilities of normal glass design, but which also successfully fuses art and architecture in this remarkable building,” according to Lee Coates, UK director, Hero Glass. The artwork was created using a silk screen print process in Hero’s factory, which gave the visual result the artist was looking for.

“Crossrail is the largest construction project in Europe and passenger safety is, of course, the paramount concern of the design team,” said Wrightstyle contracts manager, John Woodcock.

“That’s the reason why our systems have been specified across several new stations on the Elizabeth Line. We have great experience in the transportation sector, and our systems have been subjected to international testing in Europe, the USA and Asia,” he said.

T+44 (0)1380 722239
jane.embury@wrightstyle.co.uk
www.wrightstyle.co.uk
Menus.Title: Wrightstyle brings Farringdon art to life

Menus.Description: Oaks Industrial Estate, Leicester, recently benefited from a much needed lift thanks to the collaboration between Season Masters Windows and Kestrel Aluminium Systems.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Oaks Industrial Estate, Leicester, recently benefited from a much needed lift thanks to the collaboration between Season Masters Windows and Kestrel Aluminium Systems.

The project specification required the new windows to be thermally efficient to ensure that the upgrades resulted in the industrial units being economical for the occupants as well as creating a modern and clean look to the overall estate. Working to a strict schedule Season Master Windows needed to have fabricated and installed the replacement windows within eight weeks. 

Kestrel Aluminium Systems supplied the complete product kit required to fabricate the windows. The decision was made to opt for the 60mm Window System to provide maximum thermal performance, and to meet the specification of being ‘top hung open out’ to enable natural ventilation. Trickle vents were also installed to ensure constant ventilation. 

Season Master Windows was confident that it would be able to meet the time scale set as the delivery of material would be with them in full within two working weeks by Kestrel Aluminium Systems who pride themselves on their enviable service delivery turnaround times. By opting to use aluminium windows for the industrial estate it has resulted in a modern look being achieved with the added benefit of providing peace of mind for the owners and occupiers that the units are safe and secure.
Menus.Title: Modern makeover for industrial estate

Menus.Description: G16 Training Award winner Quickslide is reaping the benefits of taking its Quickslide Academy training programme to a higher level thanks to a partnership with the world-renowned Dale Carnegie organisation.
Menus.DetailDescription:
G16 Training Award winner Quickslide is reaping the benefits of taking its Quickslide Academy training programme to a higher level thanks to a partnership with the world-renowned Dale Carnegie organisation.

The Yorkshire fabricator not only picked up the prestigious award at this year’s event, but has also seen profits rise to record levels, cash flow significantly improving and even accident levels – and insurance premiums – dropping since teaming up with Dale Carnegie.

More than 40 of Quickslide’s staff have already undergone training with Dale Carnegie via tailored courses at its Brighouse HQ as well as at centres run by the organisation.

The fabricator already operates its Quickslide Academy training programme of performance and improvement courses. Last year, it set out its aim to create ‘100 problem-solvers’ in its workforce with a series of courses up to a year in length, aimed at quality, efficiency and continuous improvement.

Dale Carnegie Training, founded over a century ago, operates in more than 80 countries, delivering workplace learning and performance training to companies of all sizes, including some of the world’s biggest and best-known corporations.
Menus.Title: G16 Top Trainer Quickslide teams up with Dale Carnegie

Menus.Description: Sikasil SG-500, a high strength, fast-curing silicone adhesive from global building product manufacturer Sika, is helping ensure the safe, long-term installation of nearly 200 windows which will form a new superstore’s spectacular, structurally-glazed façade.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Sikasil SG-500, a high strength, fast-curing silicone adhesive from global building product manufacturer Sika, is helping ensure the safe, long-term installation of nearly 200 windows which will form a new superstore’s spectacular, structurally-glazed façade.

The ideal adhesive for structural glazing, Sikasil SG-500 was specified by sub-contractors Lindner Facades for a new £54 million John Lewis store in Leeds city centre. The store is designed by ACME architects, with its construction being overseen by main contractors, Sir Robert McAlpine.

Sikasil SG-500 is being used to bond 192 windows – a mix of 1m x 2m and 5m x 3m windows – to diamond-shaped steel frames which form the 25,000m2 building’s five-storey, three-dimensional façade, described by specialist retail developers Hammerson as a “future classic for architecture in Leeds”.

The steel frames which house the windows are manufactured offsite, with two glass supports and an anodising strip used to affix the windows to the frame before Sikasil SG-500 is applied. Once the adhesive – which is also renowned for its superbly clean finish – cures, the completed frames are transferred to site for installation.

Jared Laslett, Division Manager for Lindner Facades, said, “Sikasil SG-500 is the silicone adhesive we trust. We’ve used it on many previous projects, providing exactly what it promised – superb, rapid-curing adhesion.”

Sikasil SG-500 is a two-part, high-modulus, neutral-curing structural silicone adhesive. As well as window applications, Sikasil can be used for solar modules and challenging industrial applications. It provides excellent adhesion to a wide range of substrates. CE-marked and fire-rated (EN 11925-2 / DIN 4102-B1), Sikasil SG-500 is UV and weather resistant.

Sub-contractors Linder Facades began work on John Lewis’ structurally-glazed façade in January. Sikasil SG-500 will play a vital part in ensuring the outstanding-looking outlet – one of the biggest John Lewis stores outside London – will be ready to offer customers their first taste of this new retail experience on Thursday 20 October, as planned.

Menus.Description: Here at Building and Facilities News we are extremely excited to announce that Mill Heat has been chosen for our highly esteemed Heating Company of the Month profile as a result of their innovative, stylish and technology driven heating.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Here at Building and Facilities News we are extremely excited to announce that Mill Heat has been chosen for our highly esteemed Heating Company of the Month profile as a result of their innovative, stylish and technology driven heating.

Mill Heat was first set up back in 1992 by Cato Bryn. Based in Oslo, Norway, the family run business’ initial focus was on supplying BBQ and outdoor patio heating. However when Cato’s son identified a niche in the market for modern heating for the home, the company shifted focus and has since become renowned as a supplier of beautiful, minimalistic heaters. 

With a passion for innovation, Mill Heat launched the ‘Mill’ brand in 2012, offering unique, Norwegian designs that utilise SMART technology. The heaters, available from the largest retailers among Nordic countries, proved highly successful, leading Mill Heat to then bring the Mill brand to the IFA fair in Berlin, 2015, and the International Home + Houseware show in Chicago, 2016, receiving heaps of praise. Mill soon exploded with popularity and today, their electric, portable and wall mounted heating can now be found in over 20 countries across Europe, Asia and North America. 

Mill provide everything from Oil heaters to Glass Panel heaters, Wifi controlled heaters and much more. One of the places you can get your hands on Mill is through their exclusive UK distribution partner Benross Marketing. We spoke to Jon Brennan, from Benross Marketing, about what makes this brand stand out, to which he explained, “Most noticeable about Mill is the design. These heaters are designed in Oslo and are evidently Scandinavian; however it's not just about the looks. Quality, performance and ease of use are also key factors that separate us from other brands.

“As an example, under test conditions, our Mill oil heaters can heat a room up to 29% faster than a 'normal' heater of exactly the same specification. Not only does this get the room to a comfortable level quicker, but it also saves the consumer money as the digital thermostat will switch the heater off sooner.”  

Mill Heat’s Panel heaters are also extremely sought after, coming in two styles: Steel and Glass. In addition to being IP rated, these heaters are fitted with a 3 pin plug, which takes just minutes to install, and they also exude the signature Scandi-style of Mill Heat that has made them so popular. Not only that, but these heaters can also be controlled through the intuitive Mill Heat App, whereby users can set up a schedule of when to use the heater. 

Jon explained, “With the Mill Heat App, users can set up a 24/7 timer that sets the air temperature to their required level, and this can be overridden at any time from anywhere in the world. We will also be launching our WIFI connected portable heaters this autumn, which will be another huge progressive step for portable heating in the UK market. We are also soon to launch our new, highly anticipated outdoor patio heaters in the Scandinavian market.”

Currently undergoing a wave of expansion, with their hands in both European, US and Far East markets, Mill Heat are currently working to widen their reach and strengthen their distribution markets. 

If you are interested in transforming your interiors with Mill’s stunning, sleek and advanced heaters, be sure to get in contact using the details below or feel free to check out their website. 

T 0151 448 1200
www.millheat.co.uk

This allows the heater to immediately blow hot air, even when initially powered on in a very cold room, for the user’s comfort. Menus.Description: Dunham-Bush trench-heating systems were specified for Building 3 at Advanced Manufacturing Park's Technical Centre in Rotherham to offset heat losses and down draughts from the glazed facade.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Dunham-Bush trench-heating systems were specified for Building 3 at Advanced Manufacturing Park's Technical Centre in Rotherham to offset heat losses and down draughts from the glazed facade. This building provides flexible offices and workshops for up to 11 tenants involved in industries as diverse as aerospace, automotive, marine, petrochemical and power generation.

Russel Entwistle, associate mechanical engineer with M&E consultant WYG, explains, “The intention was to run continuously around the perimeter of the office space. The HTA units offered a continuous grille solution, which resulted in a high-quality finish that integrated well within the raised-floor system for the office.”

In total, 190m of Hydro-Course was installed by Wytek Electrical & Mechanical.

This trench system is only 240mm wide and 150mm deep, with an anodised satin finish and stainless-steel cross-bladed grilles and trim.

Flow and return temperatures are 70 and 50°C, respectively, to maintain a room temperature of 21°C.
Menus.Title: Dunham-Bush trench heating serves new technology centre

Menus.Description: Hard water affects around 15 million homes in the UK and most of these have no scale protection. Hard water wastes energy, shortens the life of boilers and appliances and causes the usual problems of hard water marks.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Hard water affects around 15 million homes in the UK and most of these have no scale protection. Hard water wastes energy, shortens the life of boilers and appliances and causes the usual problems of hard water marks. 

The Carbon Trust confirms that 1mm of scale on a heat transfer surface will increase energy usage by seven per cent. With no scale protection 2 or 3mm of scale on a heat transfer surface is easily achieved within two or three years, so with scale protection there is a saving of a minimum of £100 a year to the average household in reduced energy costs and substantial further savings on extending boiler and appliance life. Building regulations now recommend scale protection on hot water systems.

Extensive tests by a leading energy company proved that fitting Scaleguard increases boiler life by 45% so treating hard water gives a very quick payback as well as saving energy and extending the life of appliances.

It works by sending out a modulated electronic signal through a coil on the pipe which changes the physical properties of lime scale in the water. It alters the shape of the lime scale crystals so they can't form hard scale. Instead they just wash straight through the system and further build-up of hard scale is prevented, and existing scale is gradually absorbed.
Menus.Title: Extend boiler life by 45%

Menus.Description: Nimbus oversees fire safety in Nottingham’s Social Housing Estates
Menus.DetailDescription:
TECHNICAL CASE STUDY
Through a simple piece of hardware similar to an Internet router, fire alarm networks with limitless numbers of detectors and call points are connected to a cloud-based management system that stores events and test logs and permits remote monitoring of activity; this results in improved system compliance and optimised maintenance by highlighting the causes of repeated faults.
­
FIRE ALARM PANEL NIMBUS GATEWAY
KEY FACTS:
1 Nottingham City Homes uses the Nimbus fire alarm management system to streamline testing and
maintenance of fire alarm systems across more than 24 sites.
2 Nimbus reduces the errors and omissions inherent in the paper- or spreadsheet-based approach
to compliance management, makes tracking and rectifying faults more accurate and efficient, and
streamlines reporting to senior management.
3 A central monitoring application for all sites records alarms and allows evidence-based action to
be taken to address them.

The need for a better way...
Nottingham City Homes (NCH), which manages approximately 27,000 social housing properties on behalf of Nottingham City Council, recognised that the management of the fire alarm systems on its estates could be improved. Typically, its sites contain a large number and variety of systems and involve many different people (such as wardens, cleaners or caretakers) in checking alarms on a weekly basis as required by the Fire Safety Order 2005. These checks were previously recorded in log books stored on each site. Due to this rather cumbersome process, NCH experienced a number of issues including:
Alarms not being accurately recorded when staff members were absent from a site, leading to repeated faults which were difficult to diagnose, and sometimes to the fire brigade being called unnecessarily.
Difficulties in gathering accurate information about the status of systems; NCH staff had to sift through emails and visit sites to consult the log books, and often relied on anecdotal information from service engineers.
Delays in receiving information from service engineers testing and maintaining the system, which hindered the prioritising of maintenance work and risked increasing the occurrence of faults or false activations.
Nimbus by LAN Control Systems offered a solution that was able to address these issues. 

MODERNISING AN OUTDATED APPROACH
Nimbus is a cloud-based fire alarm management system which stores the data produced by fire alarm control panels in a secure database via a mobile phone network SIM card or Ethernet connection. NCH has installed ‘live’ Nimbus systems at a total of 24 of its social housing sites in Nottingham, including many tower blocks which, since the Grenfell fire of 2017, have been prioritised as requiring a higher level of monitoring and protection. The largest of these live systems is in the Victoria Centre, a high-profile city centre development of over 450 flats which contains eight networked panels and over 2100 separate devices. The installation on each site was simple; a single Nimbus Gateway unit, a device similar to an Internet router which converts and transmits the data, was connected to each set of networked fire control panels. Although the sites featured fire alarm control panels from companies such as Gent, Ziton, Morley and EMS, this was not an issue as Nimbus is compatible with many different analogue addressable panels.
Once installed, the Nimbus database can be accessed from anywhere with an Internet connection. An infinite event log captures every occurrence on the system and notifies assigned users by email or through a mobile app notification. This greatly helps with coordinating the response to events, such as checking if an alarm is genuine or the result of building improvement work occurring on the site. The weekly tests performed by local staff are also recorded to show which units have been tested. This information has highlighted a previously unrecognised problem on many sites with incomplete weekly checks, and as a result NCH is setting up a dedicated team to perform these checks and ensure compliance with legislation, which can then be easily demonstrated using Nimbus.
Visits by fire alarm service companies are planned and recorded by the Nimbus system, removing the potential for errors or omissions, and the Nimbus Engineer smartphone app enables images and notes to be added to the database record of a faulty or failed device during servicing. Nimbus collates all this information into a real-time overview of service progress throughout the year, and also into simple service reports, which significantly reduces the time that NCH managers have to wait to be notified of the outcome of a service visit. This is so useful that even sites without a live Gateway device have servicing data uploaded to Nimbus via the Nimbus Mobile servicing tool used by service engineers. In addition, the service companies themselves use Nimbus to receive immediate notifications of breakdowns, significantly shortening the time needed for a repair.
The NCH Nimbus system also includes the Control Room Monitor (CRM), through which the Central Nottingham City CCTV control centre can monitor the alarm systems on all the live sites. As well as receiving notifications of any events on the systems as they happen, other resources such as site maps and CCTV camera feeds can be tied in to the CRM, which assists security staff in investigating alarms before a call is made to the fire brigade. If a genuine fire alarm occurs, the CRM can then provide detailed site-specific information for relaying to fire crews attending the incident.
BENEFITS FOR ALL
The Nimbus system improves the management of the NCH fire alarm systems in a number
of key ways:

1 Testing schedules and service visit reports are reliably recorded and sent automatically to
building managers immediately following a visit; reports can be viewed without delay and are
simple to understand, ensuring system compliance is maintained with complete transparency
and a full audit trail.

2 The infinite event log records activations accurately and at any time, allowing maintenance
requirements to be identified based on hard data rather than anecdotal evidence

3 Smartphone apps reduce the administrative burden of both weekly checks by on-site staff and
full system testing by service engineers, while fully meeting legal requirements.

4 Response times to call-outs and completion rates for required tests are recorded, allowing
best value to be extracted from service contracts while ensuring that corners are not cut.

5 The CRM assists with the investigation of alarms to prevent unnecessary calls to fire brigades,
and provides useful information for firefighters in the event of a genuine incident.

A complete solution...
The various components of the Nimbus system – the Gateway unit, the event and service database, the mobile apps and the Control Room Monitor – all work together to optimise the management of fire alarm systems at multiple social housing sites across the city of Nottingham. Nimbus has allowed NCH to make cost savings estimated at 20% per annum, while in many cases improving the compliance with legal requirements and ensuring that the systems are ready for use the moment they are needed – to raise the alarm in the event of a real fire and help save residents’ lives.
Menus.Title: Nimbus

Menus.Description: Consolidation of floor paint range is leading paint manufacturer's latest innovation * Correct choice of flooring paint "crucial" to safe and effective running of large industrial and commercial premisesOne of the UK's most successful industrial paint manufacturers has unveiled the branding for its newly consolidated range of market-leading commercial floor paints
Menus.DetailDescription:
Consolidation of floor paint range is leading paint manufacturer's latest
innovation
* Correct choice of flooring paint "crucial" to safe and effective running
of large industrial and commercial premisesOne of the UK's most successful industrial paint manufacturers has unveiled
the branding for its newly consolidated range of market-leading commercial
floor paints.Following a process which saw the number of products in its floor paint
range reduce from over 70 products to eight superior products, Trimite
Global Coatings is proud to introduce the all-new Trimafloor brand to the
market.Trimite's Trimafloor floor paints are applied across an array of sectors
and settings from warehouses to event venues, sports stadia to hospitals,
and are used by some of the UK's highest-profile organisations.Trimite, which is one of the world's oldest and most respected paint
manufacturers, has undergone a business transformation over the last 18
months, during which time it has updated its external image and commercial
processes - including the significant consolidation of its floor paint
products.Sharon Harrison, Sales Director of Trimite, said the firm was excited to be
able to unveil its newly branded Trimafloor range, explaining the crucial
role such products play in the safe and effective running of large
industrial and commercial facilities.She said, "This is the culmination of lots of hard work internally looking
at the huge - and potentially confusing - range of floor paints we
previously offered, before rationalising all of that down to a simplified
proposition for our clients that fulfil all their needs without
compromising the excellence for which our paints are renowned."She continued, "Floor paints and coatings can not only reduce operational
costs, they can also ensure Health and Safety compliance and boost overall
productivity."For instance, single pack floor paints provide superior durability against
abrasion and impact, which reduces the need for regular, expensive floor
maintenance. Our paints are ideally suited to areas that see high footfall,
such as exhibition centres and hospitals."Trimite was recently contracted to deliver a floor paint solution to one of
the most technologically advanced, high profile sporting arenas anywhere in
the world, where all eyes were on its functionality and effectiveness.Away from professional sport, its floor paints are used by leisure centres
and other sporting facilities across the UK."Epoxy floor coatings build durability into operations and heighten
professionalism, making them ideal for industrial and commercial spaces,
such as warehouses and sports facilities," said Sharon."While 99.9% of people visiting such locations will pay little to zero
attention to what's directly beneath their feet, things like this do draw a
lot of attention if they are inadequate or even worse, dangerous, meaning
the choice of a trusted partner for your floor paint requirements is
absolutely crucial."Facility managers can often underestimate just how much traffic - either
through footfall or mechanical vehicles - comes into daily contact with
their floor surfaces, which could cause serious wear and tear if not
treated properly."Water based single pack floor paints aid durability against heavy duty
traffic and tolerate wet cleaning well," said Sharon. "Our paint is perfect
for garage floors. Floor sealers protect against all kinds of wear and tear
and reduce cleaning costs by minimising dust and dirt pick-up. They also
make maintenance easier, so are a great choice for this kind of
requirement."She added, "From world class facilities with exceptionally high footfall
and traffic to smaller venues, our floor paint products are the market
leading solutions for professionalism, durability and safety."We put our heart and soul into everything we do for our customers with
every product and service coming with the trusted Trimite guarantee of
excellence built in."Trimite was originally established in 1940 in West London. It has since
built its reputation on manufacturing high performance and technologically
superior paints and coatings to supply a broad range of industries
including aerospace, automotive, defence, bakeware, heavy industrial,
residential and commercial property, sports and leisure and transport. The
company also produces paints and coatings for specialist suppliers and
retailers.Growth has been achieved through innovative product development, strategic
acquisitions and development of new business propositions.The company has five UK locations, with two Midlands sites in Redditch and
Birmingham, one in the north of England in Bolton, a site in Belfast and
another in Scotland.For more information, go to: www.trimite.com

Menus.Description: Building and Facilities News is proud to announce that Furlong Flooring has been selected as our Flooring Company of the Month, for its outstanding range of carpets and hard flooring for retailers and contractors across the UK.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Building and Facilities News is proud to announce that Furlong Flooring has been selected as our Flooring Company of the Month, for its outstanding range of carpets and hard flooring for retailers and contractors across the UK.

Established in 1980 by Noel Furlong, the company is headquartered in west Dublin and has distribution centres across Ireland and the UK.  'We manufacture carpets for the domestic retail and contract sectors in a variety of competitive price points and styles,' explained Allan McDonald (Sales Director). 'We also supply a full range of hard flooring engineered wood, laminate, LVT and vinyl, delivered by our own trucks.' Indeed, unlike some traditional flooring suppliers, Furlong Flooring provides a whole portfolio of flooring solutions, making the process streamlined and simple for its customers.

Of course, Furlong Flooring is about much more than just supplying flooring. The company is committed to its customers’ needs, and ensures its quality, delivery, price and service is second to none. Furlong Flooring is also dedicated to your customers’ satisfaction, with a mission to offer only the most stylish, contemporary and well-fitting flooring to make sure they are delighted with the end result.

Over the years, Furlong Flooring has developed strong relationships with all of its customers, offering shop/contractor visits and dedicated point-of-sale materials to add value to its services and make sure it is easy for customers to present, sell and fit the company’s products. 

Offering reliable flooring solutions for every room in the home, Furlong Flooring ensures customers can source all their flooring needs from a single supplier. As a trusted carpet supplier, Furlong Flooring works closely with a large network of retail and commercial clients, offering affordable and luxury carpets with a selection of market-leading features. 'We produce a wide range of polypropylene based bleach cleanable carpets, with the added benefit of a revolutionary Combi-bac backing system on the majority of our mainstream offering for ease of fitting,' explained Allan. 'We also offer a comprehensive delivery system.'

In addition to this, Furlong Flooring’s range of wood flooring from selected suppliers features high quality products harvested in a sustainable environment, standards which are met by the company’s reliable and efficient service to retailers and commercial clients nationwide. Furthermore, the company’s comprehensive range of vinyl flooring products are held to the same exceptional standards as Furlong Flooring’s other products, ensuring customers will be more than satisfied no matter what their needs.

Furlong Flooring’s products are collected under three distinct brands, helping retailers’ customers to easily identify the flooring they are interested in. Furlong Flooring can work with retailers as a reliable supplier of carpet, hardwood flooring, laminate flooring and vinyl flooring, all without diluting a retailer’s own brand. 

Regency Carpets offers 36 separate carpet collections, which encompass everything from luxury deep-pile carpet to hard-working value range carpets. Regency Carpets products come with a ‘Manufactured in the UK’ guarantee, with a 5, 7, or 10 year wear and stain warranty (depending on the range) . Each of the carpets has a range of colours and styles, giving customers an excellent choice, no matter what their budget.

One of Regency Carpets’ notable collections is Carefree Twist. Available in 15 on-trend colours, Carefree Twist is the ideal family carpet, made with durability in mind to take on anything the family throws at it. The range also benefits from Furlong Flooring’s 10-year warranty protection.

Clearly, Furlong Flooring is committed to helping its clients sell to their customers, and helping companies to build their business and reputation. Furlong Flooring takes time to discover precisely how it can help its clients do this, offering all the support and product information anyone could need. What’s more, the company will let its customers know when new products are on the market, keeping them up to date with product changes and styles, with help and advice on hand at any time.
 
With such an impressive range of products and dedicated customer service, Furlong Flooring attends multiple trade shows to help people see first-hand the quality flooring solutions it provides. 'We attend trade shows throughout the year, starting with the January Furniture Show 19-22 January at the NEC, Birmingham, the Buying Group Show, Solihull, in 13-14 May, the Housing Show, 23-25 Manchester, in June and of course the Flooring Show, Harrogate,20-22 in September. The Housing Show was a new and very productive show to attend this year.'

Menus.DetailDescription:
Heronrib matting has recently been laid around several pools of the renowned Marisma Wellness Centre in Santander, Spain. The matting is a hygienic and slip resistant solution for wet areas manufactured in the UK and US by Plastex.

Made from flexible PVC and supplied in 10m rolls, this meant that 170m of walkways could easily be laid overnight without causing any sport activity interruptions. In the morning the centre opened at 6am with safe underfoot access provided to all swimmers.

The matting features an embossed surface which is certified Class C, the highest rating of slip resistance given on DIN 51097, as well as ensuring barefoot comfort. The open grid construction with channelled underbars allows for extra drainage, whilst anti-microbial and anti-fungal additives ensure high levels of hygiene are permanently maintained.

Heronrib matting was recommended by Plastex’s distributor in Spain for over 30 years, Decoplastics. mHeronrib is supplied in 50, 100 and 122cm widths and 10m lengths in 5 standard colours: Oxford Blue, Ocean Blue, Charcoal Grey, Forest Green and Mulberry Red. Other colours are available on request.

Plastic Extruders Ltd has been a matting manufacturer for over 50 years, ensuring high quality and service standards to a worldwide distribution network.
Menus.Title: Spanish wellness centre picks Heronrib barefoot matting

Menus.Description: Mark Rabey, General Manager & Senior Project Advisor at Caledonian Stone, a specialist stone and tile supplier, identifies the benefits of porcelain products in interiors.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Mark Rabey, General Manager & Senior Project Advisor at Caledonian Stone, a specialist stone and tile supplier, identifies the benefits of porcelain products in interiors.

The materials and products you select for interiors can make or break an environment, so you need to choose them wisely and consider the room’s purpose. This issue is even more important when it comes to flooring materials, as safety concerns such as slip resistance should be paid close attention.

In commercial buildings, there will often be high levels of footfall, especially in reception areas, dining rooms and bathrooms, so you’ll need to select materials that are durable and resilient. However, in domestic buildings, you may want to focus more on the aesthetics, such as how the materials appear visually and how they add a sense of style to a room.

A way you can meet both needs is to procure natural stone materials, and in particular, porcelain. The aesthetic benefits of porcelain are widely recognised, and it’s also incredibly hardwearing, easy to clean and has good anti-slip qualities even when it’s wet.

At Caledonian Stone, we have our own pendulum slip resistance testing equipment that ensures the products we recommend meet the correct standards in line with HSE Slip Resistance Guidelines. For example, our Logan porcelain meets these standards and is available in a range of different sizes and colours. Additionally, it has certified strength for use in commercial high traffic areas.

You can learn more about our slip resistance recommendations by getting in touch here: www.caledonianstone.com/contact and find out more about our Logan range here: www.caledonianstone.com/products/logan-autumn
Menus.Title: Caledonian Stone

Menus.Description: EGGER UK’s new OSB HDX 30mm load-bearing panels have been used by Wyder Engineered Timber Systems Ltd as part of a £250,000 expansion to its manufacturing facility near Preston in Lancashire.
Menus.DetailDescription:
EGGER UK’s new OSB HDX 30mm load-bearing panels have been used by Wyder Engineered Timber Systems Ltd as part of a £250,000 expansion to its manufacturing facility near Preston in Lancashire.

Wyder, which celebrates its 10th anniversary next year, specialises in the design, manufacture and supply of I Joist Flooring and engineered wood products to the UK construction industry.

The company has expanded its production facilities on-site by creating a 280m2 mezzanine level using EGGER OSB HDX boards to house modern, spacious offices for its growing workforce, new meeting rooms, catering and washroom facilities.

Dave Williams, Company Director at Wyder Engineered Timber Systems, said, “We’ve made a significant investment to expand and remodel the existing factory this year. This has enabled us to increase our manufacturing capacity and house a new roof truss production facility which will launch in January 2017.

“Installing a mezzanine floor has enabled us to reclaim what was otherwise wasted space. The mezzanine level is three times the size of the original area located on the ground floor. Our new purpose-built premises have doubled the space we need to enable the business to grow.

“We specified EGGER OSB HDX panels to create the substrate floor for the mezzanine level because of its performance. The panels are denser and stronger than traditional 38mm chipboard and offer superior insulation and sound reduction from the factory noise below.”

To find out more about EGGER OSB HDX, contact the EGGER building products hotline on 0845 602 4444, email: building.uk@egger.com or visit: www.egger.com/hdx
Menus.Title: EGGER flooring helps Wyder reach new heights

Menus.Description: Smarti Environmental, the UK's leading waterless urinal provider, is urging businesses in the Facilities Management sector to play their part in the battle against needless carbon emissions following Stockholm+50 (02-03 June), and World Environment Day (05 June)
Menus.DetailDescription:
Smarti Environmental, the UK's leading waterless urinal provider, is urging
businesses in the Facilities Management sector to play their part in the
battle against needless carbon emissions following Stockholm+50 (02-03
June), and World Environment Day (05 June).50 years on from the first United Nations Conference on the Human
Environment, the United Nations is warning that the climate is heating up
too quickly for people and nature to adapt. To keep global warming below
1.5°C this century, annual greenhouse gas emissions must be halved by 2030.
The UN is encouraging truly transformative options that are available,
affordable and attractive for people to make better daily decisions.Smarti Environmental, which enables existing flushing urinals to go
waterless in just a day, is encouraging organisations to urgently review
their use of flushing urinals in the ongoing climate crisis.Its research shows that there are currently around 3.5 million water-
supplied urinals in the UK, emitting 105kg of CO2, and wasting 100,000
litres of clean water per urinal, per year, which takes a huge amount of
energy to be processed. If installed on every flushing urinal in the UK,
the carbon savings gained by installing Smarti Environmental’s new retro-
fit, waterless urinal Vortex triple seal valve (TSV) would be equivalent to
taking 100,000 diesel cars off the road, and saving 217 billion litres of
water from being treated unnecessarily each year.Unlike any other waterless urinal solution, the Vortex TSV uses an eco-
friendly bio-block enzyme ring and integrated bio-tablet tablet that breaks
down uric acid and bio film proteins during use, lubricating sewerage pipes
to prevent blocked pipes, and making urine PH neutral; a world first. This
means less energy is required in sewerage treatment processing, further
reducing the environmental impact of waterless urinals versus flushing
alternatives. The Vortex triple seal technology also prevents and locks
away all bad odours from drains, providing a better user experience.To encourage the move to flushless urinals following Stockholm+50, and
World Environment Day, Smarti Environmental is offering large organisations
with 100 or more urinals within their group, a free washroom trial for 3-
months, including free installation of its retro-fit waterless Vortex
triple seal valves. Smaller businesses can also benefit from savings of
more than 50% compared to the cost of running conventional flushing
urinals.Kimberley Hill, New Business Development Manager at Smarti Environmental,
commented: “This World Environment Day, businesses have the opportunity to
play a part in reducing needless water waste and carbon emissions by
switching to waterless urinals. When you consider that waterless urinals
cut CO2 and water waste at the same time as slashing urinal running costs
by more than half – saving up to £1,200 on every three urinals in use –
it’s a change that makes complete business and environmental sense.”Kimberly Hill added: “As an accredited Carbon Neutral Business, we’re doing
all we can to make a positive difference to the environment, and that
includes the use of environment-friendly enzyme technology. This ends the
need for harsh cleaning materials, and avoids pollutants from entering the
waste-water system, further enhancing the environmental benefits of
waterless urinals. For organisations looking to a Net Zero future, we
provide part of the solution to achieving this, helping businesses save the
planet, one pee at a time."Smarti Environmental’s waterless urinals are used both by private and
public sector organisations including the NHS. In addition to cutting
costs, water use and emissions, its retro-fit, waterless one-way multi-
valve technology stops the spread of viruses through the absence of
airborne aerosol germs created by flushing urinals. Made from fully
recyclable materials, they fit 98% of standard urinals with no need to
change urinal bowls.Used in conjunction with Smarti’s eco-friendly, odour-eating and
bacteria/virus busting SteriKleen surface spray, urinal cleaning is reduced
to once every 24 hours, consisting of a wipe, spray and walk away process
that leaves urinals clean and fresh. This makes switching to waterless
urinals simple and easy, enabling businesses to Build Back Better and
Greener. Smarti Environmental also replaces blocked or partially blocked
pipework resulting from the chemical reaction between water and urine, when
installing its waterless valves to existing urinal bowls.T 01392 311202
www.smartilimited.com
Menus.Title: Facilities Management businesses urged to go waterless from World Environment Day

Menus.Description: Building and Facilities News is extremely proud to present Total Water Solutions (TWS) as its selected Water Solutions Company of the Month.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Building and Facilities News is extremely proud to present Total Water Solutions (TWS) as its selected Water Solutions Company of the Month. 

If you suffer with poor water supply, low water pressure and are only able to use one tap or shower at a time without it being disturbed, TWS has the perfect solution for you. Widely recognised to be at the forefront of the design and development of water boosting and water management systems, their innovative and superior products help prevent the growing problem of poor water pressure and reduced flow rates which affect the efficiency of today’s mains fed household and commercial water appliances.

Set up in 2006, the well-established company is the brains behind the renowned MainsBoost™ Water Performance System. Unique, patented and energy saving, the highly sought after product works by utilising patented accumulator technology to store a volume of water at pressure in a sealed hygienic container.  
As an outlet is opened water is forced out of the MainsBoost™ boosting the incoming mains water supply and delivering a constant water flow rate to unvented cylinders and combination boilers, allowing them to operate at their optimum performance. The results are truly phenomenal as users receive a real ‘power shower’ performance without the need for pumps and benefit from no electrical consumption, silent operation and no maintenance for up to 5 years. 

Available in a range of sizes and configurations, the MainsBoost™ is suitable to all applications and can be used as a single system or linked together to provide improved water storage to meet household demands. 

'Our unique and innovative system provides water where you want it, whenever you want it,' commented Managing Director Conrad Baxter. 'The advanced level of technical engagement and expertise that is used to create our products is unsurpassed by many in the industry and our experienced and dedicated team strive to provide the best water boosting solution to suit your exact requirements. 

'Working alongside plumbing contractors, architects and specifiers, housing associations, Borough Councils, the Ministry of Defence, house builders, blue chip companies and plumbing merchants across the UK, TWS strives to deliver effective water management solutions to combat the problems caused by poor water pressure.'

In addition to the MainsBoost™, TWS also provide a full range of high quality, energy efficient, water performance products covering the full spectrum of domestic and commercial applications. These include the innovative and unique iBoost-200, AquaBoost variable speed booster sets, PureStor GRP cold water storage tanks and the AquaStor range of unvented and tank-in-tank hot water cylinders, as well as a range of water management and conservation products.

To accompany these highly efficient products, the skilled team offer a whole host of quality services including site surveys, design assistance and training in patented, accumulated technology to ensure you are getting the best out of your system. 

'The future looks extremely bright for TWS,' Conrad concluded. 'Just last year we joined forces with Stuart Turner Ltd – the UK's market leading shower and water boosting pump manufacturer. The acquisition has allowed us to continue pushing boundaries in providing the most innovative water boosting solutions throughout the UK and ROI. 

'At TWS, you will find a company committed to providing a high level of service, and which has become one of the UK’s leading authorities on delivering improved water performance for both residential and commercial properties. We pride ourselves on the high quality of our products, technical support teams, and customer service department to ensure we remain at the forefront of the ‘people to do business with!'
Menus.Title: Water Boosting Solutions...The Greener Way

Menus.Description: Leafield Environmental, has reported record sales of its cup recycling bins as a direct result of the renewed commitment of businesses to tackle the much publicised issue of disposable cup waste.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Leafield Environmental, has reported record sales of its cup recycling bins as a direct result of the renewed commitment of businesses to tackle the much publicised issue of disposable cup waste. As many as 5 billion paper cups are used and disposed of each year in the UK which, due to the previous lack of recycling solutions, were either incinerated or sent to landfill. 

Leafield has been working with Simply Cups, the UK’s only cup recycling scheme, which has resulted in an expansion of its cup bin range and increase in sales.

According to Justin Salmon, Business Development Manager for Leafield Environmental; “We knew our customers genuinely wanted to recycle their cups because it improves their recycling targets, avoids waste going to landfill and enhances their environmental credentials. Now that there is a robust scheme in operation, through Simply Cups, there is a huge incentive for businesses to recycle their cups, which gives us the opportunity to help them find the best bin for their needs.”
Menus.Title: Sales of cup recycling solutions have never been stronger

Menus.Description: Leafield Environmental has launched a new EnvirocupXL recycling unit to collect larger coffee cups (up to 103mmm), providing a solution to prevent huge amounts going to landfill for facility managers. Suitable for food serving areas and offices.
Menus.DetailDescription:
Leafield Environmental has launched a new EnvirocupXL recycling unit to collect larger coffee cups (up to 103mmm), providing a solution to prevent huge amounts going to landfill for facility managers. Suitable for food serving areas and offices. 

The cups can be dropped through the circular apertures and easily stacked inside the collection tubes, making it extremely easy to empty and clean. It also features a new improved liquid hub, to hold up to 7.5 litres of liquid reservoir to avoid access spillages. Dimensions: H: 803mm, W: 444mm, D: 444mm.

The unit is available in black and ivory with a boat blue liquid hub and comes with a recycling label as standard. Black unit is made from 95% recycled plastic. An A4 signage kit is available as an optional extra, as well as bespoke personalisation labels and unit colours.

The unit is priced RRP £169.99 per unit.
Menus.Title: Making recycling cups easier

Menus.Description: Megger are the world’s leader in electrical test solutions and have been designing and manufacturing innovative portable test equipment and for over a century now – as well as providing expert support locally
Menus.DetailDescription:
Megger are the world’s leader in electrical test solutions and have been
designing and manufacturing innovative portable test equipment and for over
a century now – as well as providing expert support locally. Headquartered
in Dover, Kent, this British manufacturer today has grown a global presence
all over the world, employing over 1,300 skilled staff in the UK and
internationally. As a result, Megger have become a top choice for
electrical equipment amongst contractors, power stations, electricity
supply companies and the manufacturing industry.

Megger’s Application Engineer, Tony Wills, explains, “Our mission is to
help you keep your Power On. We focus on developing state-of-the-art
testing solutions for ease-of-use, safety, performance and reliability – so
that our clients can make better, informed decisions about their assets
with our measurement results and insights, increasing uptime and safety.”

High Voltage Solutions – Taking care of your most important assets
Megger made waves throughout the industry with their product range for
preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and commissioning of electricity
transmission & distribution systems – covering literally everything from
cables to transformers and general-purpose testers.

When it comes to Cable Testing, for example, Megger prioritise flexibility
and the ability to find cable faults quickly. With the enormous changes in
energy demand, electricity networks need to be flexible enough to cope with
surges in power usage. Megger wants users to be able to quickly locate
cable faults – perhaps with the aid of their EZThump range of portable high
voltage fault locators.

Megger’s Impedance Meter, the NIM1000, is designed to measure the grid
impedance of the phase and neutral conductor up to the 10th harmonic. We
asked Tony how this works, and he explained, “The NIM1000 measures three
phase loop impedance to verify design calculations and detect faults in
high energy, low voltage networks. Very low loop impedances on systems are
usually difficult to measure and lead to high prospective fault currents.”

The NIM1000 can however root out load-sensitive and neutral faults, weak
contacts, hidden flaws and more (thanks to its innovative impedance meter).
The NIM1000 can also be used to measure the capacity of the power grid
under real-life conditions, determine the voltage dip resulting from a
given load, and perform tests on everything from cables to power supply
lines to bus-bars – determining the correct dimensions for installation.
After collecting the data, users can have an accurate and comprehensive
evaluation of the power grid’s current load capacity, and any voltage
fluctuations under load.

In the Megger range there are also some circuit breaker test sets and
analysis systems. Their Smart Primary Injection Test System has proven
particularly popular, being the first high current test system that allows
users to type in a predetermined current, with the SPI system generating
and regulating the requested high current without preheating the test
sample. The SPI system can also be used for high current testing of
overcurrent relays, circuit breakers, motor overloads and current
transformers.

Low Voltage Installation (LVI) Solutions – Making electricians happy!
We also spoke to Megger’s Technical Support Engineer, Ian Bensted, about
their low voltage solutions. Megger’s handheld Portable Appliance Testers,
or PAT machines, are perfect for testing either portable or fixed
electrical equipment, whether it’s for continuity tests, insulation tests,
substitution leakage tests, differential leakage tests or extension
portable RCD tests. The PAT100 series comes in rubber armoured cases,
scratch-proof glass, rechargeable options and a simple tick or cross that
indicates pass or fail. The PAT devices are ideal for testing in a variety
of environments (offices, shops or business units) or where electrical
supply is inconvenient or unsafe.

Ian explained, “The PAT300 and PAT400 expand on the abilities of the PAT100
series, with the PAT300 offering 230V and 110V operation, manual or
automatic testing, and the ability to perform differential, touch or
substitute leakage. The PAT300 comes with a number of helpful accessories,
such as a combined earth-bond and insulation test lead, an adaptor for
testing extension leads, and even a handy carry case.

“As for the PAT400, the newest generation of Megger’s PAT equipment, it
comes with a 10,000 record memory storage, USB download ability, a user-
friendly QWERTY keyboard and even an optional barcode scanner and printer –
a true time-saver when typing asset IDs!”

For electricians seeking advanced means of low voltage testing, Megger’s
MFT1700 series offers the perfect package. Capable of testing low voltage
electrical installations to BS7671, the MFT1700 series can be used for
industrial, commercial and domestic fixed wiring installations. Designed to
be durable and completely safe to use, the products in this series feature
IP54 protection against dust and water as well as an EN61010 Cat IV safety
rating. The MFT1711 is ideal for domestic installation testing, and comes
in a robust moulded case for added protection. The MFT1721 is particularly
good for the commercial markets and loop testing thanks to its additional
phase-to-phase testing.

Ian added, “The MFT1741 is the most powerful of the MFT1700 series, with a
wide range of additional capabilities such as earth electrode test
functions. In addition, it also features built in memory and downloadable
data storage via Bluetooth. It also comes with the optional PowerSuite Lite
software, which provides easy to use electronic form completion that can be
downloaded to smartphones or computers. The MFT1741 also arrives in a
large, spacious soft pouch that can fit extra tools, earth electrode test
kits and more. Going into the future, we will be expanding our low voltage
product range and investing in our products to bring about more advanced
equipment.”

The World of Megger – How to Get in Touch!
Due to the global pandemic this year we have attended a number of online
events and have more planned for the end of this year and going into 2021.
All of the events are listed on the Megger website.

To get in touch with Megger today to learn more about how the Megger
solutions can leverage your business, or to book a demo, please visit:
www.uk.megger.com or email: uksales@megger.com
